page.title: 04Games children play
page.content: After asking the children of today, we conducted a survey of the older members of our community to find out how they spent school breaktimes. The most popular games were hopscotch, what's the time Mr Wolf?, tig-tag, skipping, marbles, and whip and top. Apart from whip and top, all of these games are still played periodically by children today in this area. Such games tend to come as crazes probably triggered off by one child talking to his or her grand-parents about the games they used to play. Teachers do not usually encourage hopscotch unless there is a marked pitch on the playground because children make a mess on the ground with chalk.
